Text:
Within a spacious drawing room, a small discussion
is underway.
Firstly, this...
An artifact? And one in a functional state, no less.

We seized it from the facilities of a certain group
who call themselves "the Cult of Diablos" during
the incident the other day...
We have no further details... Soâ€”
Sherry Barnett.

We would like to ask you, the most celebrated mind in
the kingdom, to decipher its nature.
Huh...? But...I'm still a student.

The fruits of your research are widely known both
here and abroad. I am certain that there is no
greater expert than you in this field.

We even hear talk of you at the Academy for Dark
Knights.
This is a fine opportunity. Why not accept it?
Assistant Principal Lutheran Barnett...
"Father" will do just fine.
There is mirth in Lutheran's voice.
Sherry.

Someday your research will take you out into the
world. A request from Princess Iris is a good step
towards a bright future for you.
Yes, but this is much too...
Lutheran places his hand on Sherry's head.
Have faith in yourself. You can do it.
This is a job only you can perform.
...All right.

Ancient script, I see... Well, this is certainly a
task for me.
Sherry stares at the artifact with great interest.

As a precaution, I will assign the Crimson Order for
security.
The Crimson Order...?
Ah yes, the new order founded by Her Highness...

The truth is, the Cult of Diablos is seeking this
artifact.
That all sounds very unsettling.

Of course, we also seized many other documents and
articles that were kept under lock and key. However,
these were lost recently when some unknown agent
set fire to the storeroom.
All that remains is this lone artifact.

Ah yes, the fire from the other day. On that note,
that incident was what prompted you to found
this new knight order, was it not, Princess?

Though our numbers are few, each member can
be trusted.

Am I to take it that you cannot say the same of the
existing order?

Iris had no answer for Lutheran's pointed question.
She merely regarded him, her expression unchanging.

Hmph, very well. I'll permit a detail of two of your
knights.

Only two... In that case, I have no issue placing
myself in the detail.

Glen, I place this matter in your hands. You and
Marco may see to the security.
Leave it to us.
Iris, I would like to help, too.

If we are assigning some of our number as guards,
that leaves fewer of us to deal with the Ebony
Incident.

The Crimson Order is still very shorthanded. That,
and I know who he is. I'm perfect for this.
But Alexia, you are stillâ€”

A student. A student, but that doesn't matter if I'm
skilled enough. You said as much yourself.
I did nothing of the sort.
Well, you said something like that to Sherry.
And to think you were once so cute...

I heard that. I need to know, Iris. What it is they
want...
And...if they are our enemies.
You do know it will be dangerous.
Yes, I'm aware of that.
Iris and Alexia regard each other for a moment.

Fine. I'll enlist your aid, but only so long as it
doesn't interfere with your studies, and only
for missions that are relatively safe.
Thank you.
I appreciate your cooperation with the artifact.
Iris sighs, thanking Sherry once more.
Hey! We're gonna miss curfew!

All because you took so long, Cid! With that lovey-
dovey smoochy-woochy survey!
Did I not say sorry and give you chocolate?

(The sun is getting pretty low as the three of us run
through the capital.)

(Yeah, part of it was that I was gone a while,
but part of it was also that these two dimwits
wouldn't stop pestering me about the girl.)

(Nu, was it? Anyway, I did what I could to satisfy
their curiosity without giving away too much.)
(That aside...)
(I can't believe Alexia became a mass murderer.)
(She's actually gone and done it, huh?)

(The incident on the rooftop the other day is another
matter, but I can't understand what would cause a
girl of her privileged status to do such a thing...)
(The minds of women are a mystery to me.)
Hey, did you hear somethin'?
Not me.
(Skel and Po talk as they run up ahead of me.)

(The two of them may not have heard the noise,
but to me it was loud and clear.)

(It was the sound of swords clashing. Somewhere
out there, a fight is underway.)
Hey, hurry it up!
It's almost curfew!
(I point to an alley, then speak.)
I'm gonna poop.
What?!
(Po and Skel share a look of disbelief.)

I can't hold it anymore... If I don't go now, 
I'll end up crapping my pants.
Th-That would be a serious bummer.
Curfew or dignity...
Their faces grow serious.

You guys go on ahead... I don't want 
anyone to see this...
B-But...!

Ugh! Fine, we won't breathe a word about your outdoor
poop adventure. It's a promise between us men!

No matter what anyone thinks, Cid, you made the right
choice! That's what I believe!
Urk...! I-I'm about to blow! Hurry up and go!!!
Cid... We'll never forget ya.
Even if you did pop a squat in the street!
Now go! Gooooooo!!!
(The two of them turn heel and take off running.)
(I watch them run off for some time.)
Now then.
(I head toward the sound of battle.)

(Alexia... I don't actually care all that much if you're
a mass murderer. That's your choice if that's how you
wanna live.)

(But stealing the name of the Shadow Garden to do so
is another story... Sorry, but there's no way I'm
gonna let that slide.)
(The sounds of battle lead me into a dim back alley.)

(There I find two dark knights locked in combat. One
wears a familiar charcoal uniform and short skirtâ€”
That has to be Alexia.)

(But the other is a masked man wearing black from
head to toe.)

(Something is definitely off here. I can see Alexia
being the one claiming our name if she were
draped in all black, but that's not the case.)

(I decide to climb up onto a rooftop and conceal
myself to see how this plays out.)
Give up. You can't beat me.

(Alexia has the upper hand. Not to say that the guy
in black is weakâ€”he just can't keep up with someone
who's been honing her skills.)

(The guy's black coat is all sliced up, and his blood
paints the cobblestones. Just a little more, and this
fight will be over.)

Why murder innocent people? Is this the war you are
willing to wage?
We are the Shadow Garden...

Yes, I heard you before. Is this the will of the man
they call Shadow?
We are the Shadow Garden...
The guy in black repeats himself.
(No doubt about it. He's the one impersonating us.)

(Sorry, Alexia. Looks like you were innocent all
along.)

(Still, why would this chump pretend to be from the
Shadow Garden?)

(That's the obvious question to ask, but the truth is,
I already know the answer. I know it precisely
because of who I am.)

(It's adoration. He worships the Shadow Garden...and
shadowbrokers.)

(I can't fault him for having those feelings. After
all, I, too, got here out of my own admiration for
those who wield power from the shadows.)

(In the early days, I imitated all those cool
shadowbrokers I saw in movies, anime,
and manga.)

(Now he is following that same path by trying to
emulate the Shadow Garden.)

(And so we have the first Shadow Garden wannabe in
this world.)

(I feel something hot well up in my chest. It's
happiness at knowing my chosen course had
been correct, that it's been validated by a
third party.)

(I can't acknowledge this happiness, though. I'm a
shadowbroker, after all.)

(Allowing someone else to steal the name of my
organization will cost me that status.)

(He's a shadowbroker, and so am I. There's no room
for compromise or leniency there.)
Time to end this.

(Just as Alexia knocks away the wannabe's blade,
I feel a new presence approaching.)
